articles.title: Korean Socialism Praised by Egyptian Figure
articles.content:
Korean Socialism Praised by Egyptian Figure 
    Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- While staying in the DPRK, I had opportunities to see for myself great successes made by the DPRK under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
 Yehia Zakaria Khairallah, secretary general of the Arab Association for Arts, Culture and Information of Egypt, said this at a meeting held in Cairo on Sept. 6 to hear his report about his visit to the DPRK to attend the Meeting Dedicated to the Great Persons of Mt. Paektu and the World Conference for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea. Giving his impressions of various functions he attended, he noted that he had the honor of being seated near Kim Jong Il when appreciating the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang,"     "Kim Il Sung Prize" laureate.
 Kim Jong Il is deeply respected and trusted not only by the Korean people but by the world progressive people, he said, and continued:    
 Miraculous successes have been achieved in building a great prosperous powerful socialist nation in the DPRK under his wise leadership in recent years.
 Thanks to the Songun politics pursued by him the military capability of the DPRK and its overall national power have grown stronger than ever before.
 The U.S. styling itself "the world's only superpower" dares not provoke the DPRK.
 Korean socialism will be ever-victorious as long as it is led by the great His Excellency Kim Jong Il.    
 I will work hard to disseminate the Juche idea and boost the friendly relations with the DPRK.

Photo, Book, Handicraft and Art Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Photo, Book, Handicraft and Art Exhibition Opens 
    Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of photos, books, handicrafts and art pieces opened in the Korean Cultural Center in Artsyom City under the co-sponsorship of the United Confederation of Koreans (Kothongryon) in Maritime Territory of Russia, Kothongryon in Artsyom City and the Maritime Territory Association of Korean Nationals in Russia on Sept. 7 to celebrate the 57th anniversary of the DPRK.
 Present at the opening ceremony were Pak Phyong Won, chairman of the Kothongryon in Maritime Territory of Russia, Kim Kyong Ryol, vice-chairman of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia, and other compatriots.
 Jong Kum San, first vice-chairman of the Kothongryon in Artsyom City, in an opening address said that President   Kim Il Sung is the eternal sun of Juche and father of socialist Korea, highly praising his exploits performed in the nation-building.
 He stressed the need for the Koreans in Russia to uphold leader   Kim Jong Il with loyalty.

articles.title: National Day of DPRK Observed
Kye Sun Hui Emerges Thrice World Judo Title Holder
articles.content:
Kye Sun Hui Emerges Thrice World Judo Title Holder 
    Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK judoist Kye Sun Hui bagged a gold medal by coming first in the 57kg category of women's judo in the 2005 World Judo Championships held in Cairo.
 Kye Sun Hui, winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, labor hero and people's sportswoman, has thus emerged a thrice world woman judo title holder.    
 The 2005 championships drew more than 520 judokas from 95 countries. She beat a Swedish rival by wazari in the first match of preliminaries.    
 Then she trounced her American rival by ippon through immobilization. She proceeded to the final after beating Austrian and Cuban judokas by ippon.
 She had a final match with her German rival on Sept. 10. Kye won ippon by throwing the opponent by buttock in its 50th second, thus holding the world judo title again.
 Meanwhile, DPRK judoka An Kum Ae placed third in the women's 52kg category of the championships.

Congratulations to Egyptian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Egyptian President
    Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a congratulatory message to Mohamed Hosni Mubarak upon his reelection as president of Egypt.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will grow stronger in the future, the message sincerely wished the Egyptian president good health and happiness and new success in his responsible work for the stability and the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Sent to DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Sent to DPRK Embassies
    Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were sent to DPRK missions in different countries by political parties, ministries, organizations and senior officials of those countries in celebration of the 57th birthday of the DPRK.
 Among them were the Department of External Relations of the Central Committee of the Communist Party, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Defence, the Ministry of Social Security, the Ministry of Culture and Information, the Ministry of Education and Training and the Union of Friendship Organizations of Viet Nam, the Commission for External Affairs of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and the deputy prime minister and foreign minister, the president of the State Inspection Committee and the minister of Health who are members of the Central Committee of the Party, the chairman of the Proletarian and Islamic Revolutionary Wounded Organization, the vice-minister of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics and the general secretary of the "Workers' House" of Iran, and the chairman of the National Progressive Unionist Party and the vice-chairman of the National Democratic Party of Egypt.
 The floral baskets were laid before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the missions.

Elimination of Flunkeyist Traitors in S. Korea Urged
articles.content:
Elimination of Flunkeyist Traitors in S. Korea Urged
    Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- The National Affairs Institute and the Compilation Committee for Biographical Dictionary of Pro-Japanese Koreans in south Korea jointly made public the list of at least 3,200 pro-Japanese elements on August 29, 95 years after the Japanese imperialists' fabrication of Korea-Japan "Annexation Treaty" and their proclamation that "Korea is completely annexed to the empire of Japan."
 A spokesman for the DPRK History Society stated in a statement on Sept. 11 that the publication of the list of pro-Japanese elements clearly showed once again how foul anti-national the "legitimacy" clamored by the successive dictatorial regimes in south Korea was and why national unity and reunification were not achieved.
 Doings by the successive regimes in south Korea had been consistent with shame and disgrace, he said, and continued:    
 Even after the liberation of Korea the foreign forces' colonial rule has been maintained by the traitors to the nation who committed treacherous actions, kowtowing to the Japanese imperialists only for their own pleasure and wealth in disregard of the destiny of the nation. Yusin dictatorship sprouted out of that root, which was succeeded by the military dictatorships of the fifth and the sixth republics and the "civilian" dictatorship.

articles.title: Withdrawal of S. Korean Troops from Iraq Urged
articles.content:
Withdrawal of S. Korean Troops from Iraq Urged
    Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities, not content with staging war exercises with the U.S. against their fellow countrymen in the north, conducted exercises under the simulated conditions of an actual  war against the north even in Iraq. This is an intolerable crime against the nation. A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland said this when answering a question raised by KCNA Monday. The dispatch of south Korean troops to Iraq is aimed to let them accumulate experience of an actual war and round off the preparations for a war of aggression against the north, he said, and continued:
  South Korea's Jaitun unit in Iraq has already conducted in the last 12 months more than 2,900 military exercises under the simulated conditions of an actual war including "combined operation" with the U.S. through which it claimed it has boosted the army's capacity to carry out an operation in "contingency."    
 The south Korean military authorities also seek to send special warfare troops to Iraq and let them get experience in "the civil-related operation" for maintaining security and controlling civilians in the north in the event of "contingency".
 The south Korean authorities are talking about "reconciliation" and "cooperation" before the north side but whetting their swords to do harm to their dialogue partner when they go back. This double-dealing behavior is intolerable, the spokesman warned, urging them to pull at once their units from Iraq as demanded by the public at home and abroad.

Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
    Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and conversed with the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan led by Ko Tok U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, to celebrate the 57th birthday of the DPRK in an atmosphere overflowing with compatriotic feelings at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand were officials concerned.
